content:
WebSocket Class

Definition

The WebSocket class allows applications to send and receive data after the WebSocket upgrade has completed.

In this Article

public abstract class WebSocket : IDisposable
Inheritance
Object
WebSocket
Derived
ClientWebSocket
AspNetWebSocket

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Some of the classes in the System.Net.WebSockets namespace are supported on Windows 7, Windows Vista SP2, and Windows Server 2008. However, the only public implementations of client and server WebSockets are supported on Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012. The classes and class elements in the System.Net.WebSockets namespace that are supported on Windows 7, Windows Vista SP2, and Windows Server 2008 are abstract classes. This allows an application developer to inherit and extend these abstract classes with an actual implementation of client WebSockets.

Constructors

WebSocket()

Creates an instance of the WebSocket class.

protected WebSocket ();

Properties

CloseStatus

Indicates the reason why the remote endpoint initiated the close handshake.

public abstract Nullable<System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus> CloseStatus { get; }
Value
Nullable<WebSocketCloseStatus>

Returns WebSocketCloseStatus.

Remarks

If the close handshake has not been initiated yet, WebSocketCloseStatus.None is returned.

CloseStatusDescription

Allows the remote endpoint to describe the reason why the connection was closed.

public abstract string CloseStatusDescription { get; }
Value
String

Returns String.

DefaultKeepAliveInterval

Gets the default WebSocket protocol keep-alive interval in milliseconds.

public static TimeSpan DefaultKeepAliveInterval { get; }
Value
TimeSpan

Returns TimeSpan.

The default WebSocket protocol keep-alive interval in milliseconds. The typical value for this interval is 30 seconds.

State

Returns the current state of the WebSocket connection.

public abstract System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState State { get; }
Value
WebSocketState

Returns WebSocketState.

SubProtocol

The subprotocol that was negotiated during the opening handshake.

public abstract string SubProtocol { get; }
Value
String

Returns String.

Methods

Abort()

Aborts the WebSocket connection and cancels any pending IO operations.

public abstract void Abort ();

CloseAsync(WebSocketCloseStatus, String, CancellationToken)

Closes the WebSocket connection as an asynchronous operation using the close handshake defined in the WebSocket protocol specification section 7.

public abstract System.Threading.Tasks.Task CloseAsync (System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus closeStatus, string statusDescription, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
Parameters
closeStatus
WebSocketCloseStatus

Indicates the reason for closing the WebSocket connection.

statusDescription
String

Specifies a human readable explanation as to why the connection is closed.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken

The token that can be used to propagate notification that operations should be canceled.

Returns
Task

Returns Task.

The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

This operation will not block. The returned Task object will complete after the WebSocket has been closed.

This method closes the WebSocket connection using the close handshake defined in the WebSocket protocol specification section 7.

CloseOutputAsync(WebSocketCloseStatus, String, CancellationToken)

Initiates or completes the close handshake defined in the WebSocket protocol specification section 7.

public abstract System.Threading.Tasks.Task CloseOutputAsync (System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus closeStatus, string statusDescription, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
Parameters
closeStatus
WebSocketCloseStatus

Indicates the reason for closing the WebSocket connection.

statusDescription
String

Allows applications to specify a human readable explanation as to why the connection is closed.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken

The token that can be used to propagate notification that operations should be canceled.

Returns
Task

Returns Task.

The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

This operation will not block. The returned Task object will complete after the output on the WebSocket has been closed.

CreateClientBuffer(Int32, Int32)

Create client buffers to use with this WebSocket instance.

public static ArraySegment<byte> CreateClientBuffer (int receiveBufferSize, int sendBufferSize);
Parameters
receiveBufferSize
Int32

The size, in bytes, of the client receive buffer.

sendBufferSize
Int32

The size, in bytes, of the send buffer.

Returns
ArraySegment<Byte>

Returns stem.ArraySegment`1.

An array with the client buffers.

CreateClientWebSocket(Stream, String, Int32, Int32, TimeSpan, Boolean, ArraySegment<Byte>)

This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Allows callers to create a client side WebSocket class which will use the WSPC for framing purposes.

public static System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket CreateClientWebSocket (System.IO.Stream innerStream, string subProtocol, int receiveBufferSize, int sendBufferSize, TimeSpan keepAliveInterval, bool useZeroMaskingKey, ArraySegment<byte> internalBuffer);
Parameters
innerStream
Stream

The connection to be used for IO operations.

subProtocol
String

The subprotocol accepted by the client.

receiveBufferSize
Int32

The size in bytes of the client WebSocket receive buffer.

sendBufferSize
Int32

The size in bytes of the client WebSocket send buffer.

keepAliveInterval
TimeSpan

Determines how regularly a frame is sent over the connection as a keep-alive. Applies only when the connection is idle.

useZeroMaskingKey
Boolean

Indicates whether a random key or a static key (just zeros) should be used for the WebSocket masking.

internalBuffer
ArraySegment<Byte>

Will be used as the internal buffer in the WPC. The size has to be at least 2 * ReceiveBufferSize + SendBufferSize + 256 + 20 (16 on 32-bit).

Returns
WebSocket

Returns WebSocket.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

CreateServerBuffer(Int32)

Creates a WebSocket server buffer.

public static ArraySegment<byte> CreateServerBuffer (int receiveBufferSize);
Parameters
receiveBufferSize
Int32

The size, in bytes, of the desired buffer.

Returns
ArraySegment<Byte>

Returns stem.ArraySegment`1.

Dispose()

Used to clean up unmanaged resources for ASP.NET and self-hosted implementations.

public abstract void Dispose ();

IsApplicationTargeting45()

Returns a value that indicates if the WebSocket instance is targeting .NET Framework 4.5.

public static bool IsApplicationTargeting45 ();
Returns
Boolean

Returns Boolean.

true if the WebSocket is targeting .NET Framework 4.5; otherwise false.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

IsStateTerminal(WebSocketState)

Returns a value that indicates if the state of the WebSocket instance is closed or aborted.

protected static bool IsStateTerminal (System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState state);
Parameters
state
WebSocketState

The current state of the WebSocket.

Returns
Boolean

Returns Boolean.

true if the WebSocket is closed or aborted; otherwise false.

ReceiveAsync(ArraySegment<Byte>, CancellationToken)

Receives data from the WebSocket connection asynchronously.

public abstract System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketReceiveResult> ReceiveAsync (ArraySegment<byte> buffer, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
Parameters
buffer
ArraySegment<Byte>

References the application buffer that is the storage location for the received data.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken

Propagates the notification that operations should be canceled.

Returns
Task<WebSocketReceiveResult>

Returns stem.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.

The task object representing the asynchronous operation. The stem.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.Result* property on the task object returns a Byte array containing the received data.

Remarks

This operation will not block. The returned Task<TResult> object will complete after the data has been received on the WebSocket.

Exactly one send and one receive is supported on each WebSocket object in parallel.

RegisterPrefixes()

This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. Allows callers to register prefixes for WebSocket requests (ws and wss).

public static void RegisterPrefixes ();
Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

SendAsync(ArraySegment<Byte>, WebSocketMessageType, Boolean, CancellationToken)

Sends data over the WebSocket connection asynchronously.

public abstract System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendAsync (ArraySegment<byte> buffer, System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketMessageType messageType, bool endOfMessage, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
Parameters
buffer
ArraySegment<Byte>

The buffer to be sent over the connection.

messageType
WebSocketMessageType

Indicates whether the application is sending a binary or text message.

endOfMessage
Boolean

Indicates whether the data in “buffer” is the last part of a message.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken

The token that propagates the notification that operations should be canceled.

Returns
Task

The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

This operation will not block. The returned Task object will complete after the data has been sent on the WebSocket.

Exactly one send and one receive is supported on each WebSocket object in parallel.

ThrowOnInvalidState(WebSocketState, WebSocketState[])

Verifies that the connection is in an expected state.

protected static void ThrowOnInvalidState (System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState state, System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketState[] validStates);
Parameters
state
WebSocketState

The current state of the WebSocket to be tested against the list of valid states.

validStates
WebSocketState[]

List of valid connection states.
